title: KALOKAGATHIA
content:
KALOKAGATHIA (Calocagathia) was the personified spirit (daimona) of nobility and goodness. She was
        associated with Arete (Virtue).

Probably a daughter of ZEUS like other moral personifications, though
        nowhere stated

Telesilla, Fragment 725 (trans. Campbell, Vol. Greek Lyric IV) (Greek lyric C5th
          B.C.) :
        "Athene was like a beautiful, tall woman--Homer conveys by this means the comeliness and modesty of her
        appearance, just like Xenophon and Telesilla of Argos in their representation of Arete (Virtue) and Kalokagathia
        (Nobility)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
